website_summaries.verdict: Despite some quirks, this motherboard is a good option for serious gamers who are watching their bottom line.
pros: Although reasonably affordable, this gaming motherboard offers features gamers love, including excellent image quality, streamlined design, and over-voltage protection
Audio Boost adds to the gaming experience it provides
cons: BIOS update is required in order for it to be compatible with some newer processors

customer_reviews.title: Great board for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great board for the price, has a ton of USB 3.0 ports and is compatible with my 6600k and Geforce 1060 despite it's size.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Hippie

customer_reviews.title: simply thanks!
customer_reviews.text: buying this was so amazing. The questions helped me so much and the answers for the product are done so quick and in a way I could understand, as for someone like me who was buying computer parts for my son as gifts for him to build a computer, this was the best and most informative on the web. Thank you not only for a great product but for awesome information...
customer_reviews.author: sarah pullins

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the MSI H110i Pro motherboard for my new PC build. It is perfect for my needs/usage and has the best port layout I have seen on an iTX motherboard. (Everything is along the outer edges of the board) Pros: Excellent Build Quality Perfect Port Layout Great Design Full Fan Control via Nice BIOS Supports M.2 PCIe 2.0 x4 SSD Cons: Everything I would list here would be of direct limitation to the Intel H110 chipset itself If you don't need the overclocking capabilities of the Z170 chipset or the RAID capabilities and extra SATA/USB ports on the H170 chipset than the H110 chipset is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The little motherboard that could! This thing is great for a budget build. It comes with all the essentials (except for a built in wi-fi) but other than that it’s great. I took a star off because it does have some bloatware pre-installed that you need to manually uninstall if you don’t want to see the anti-virus notifications pop up every once in a while. I wouldn’t recommend this motherboard if you’re trying to overclock or do intense editing/gaming. But for the casual user, it’ll be more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ryu007

customer_reviews.title: recommend using a windows 64 bit.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good on the mother board works like a champ, play world of Warcraft, this game uses a lot of data transfer have no lag issues,running windows 8.1 64 bit version only using 8 megs ddr4 2100( 2 sticks) of ram. Ran on stick in slot 1 and the other in 3 to get duel processing the mother board asking to put (16 megs) memory.. Using m.2 Samsung 960 gaming pro 500 meg card and MSI 1050i video card ,1000 Meg hard drive and I5 Intel processor dint have to over clock the memory the much just little running the memory at 1850 works smooth THANKS MSI..
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great for Linux
customer_reviews.text: I've read here that people had issues with bluetooth but that's not the case for me. I was able to use my devices without any effort. As far as booting, I was able to boot to Ubuntu without any issues. However it wouldn't boot the second time due to some issue, but I was able to fix that issue by testing it on another monitor. The PC worked and I was able to find out that it was the power supply not correctly seated. So it works just fine with Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Edgardo Peregrino

customer_reviews.title: Dead out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I pulled this out of the box and installed it. It is completely dead. I wrote to the seller and they have yet to respond. The product is defective, but I am not saying this brand or even this item is not of good quality. I am saying the seller is NON supportive. Again, this item was DEAD OUT OF THE BOX. Update, MSI will not support a repair on this board, so I have a 70 dollar piece of junk. It was damaged OUT OF THE BOX and both the seller and MSI will not support a fix.
customer_reviews.author: NetCom IT Services, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Great with monitors with a catch...
customer_reviews.text: Great mother board great price. I also love how you can connect two displays without a graphics card. I connect one via the vga and one via the DVI port on the motherboard and they work just fine. I did have some problems with the display drivers in the beginning with windows 10 before connecting the two and powering on photoshop so update your drivers manually via software update by clicking on the device in device manager. That seemed to help me get rid of the blue screens.
customer_reviews.author: Johnl4th

customer_reviews.title: A big no go . Yet ANOTHER disappointment from MSI  F-  -5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything lit for a second on boot, then ... nothing, Bought the same board over a year ago and it's still running fine (HOW?). What gives MSI? The only bad boards I've had in the past decade that have been trouble have been MSI. Advice: NEVER, EVER do a bios upgrade on an MSI. Every board that I have tried that on has become nonfunctional and had to be trashed. EVERY ONE! Can't afford to stick with them. Time to switch manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny P

customer_reviews.title: Despite negative reviews - it works just fine with 6th generation processors (I have it running with ...
customer_reviews.text: Ended up getting the board because of it's compatibility with smaller microATX cases (got it for the Thermaltake Core V1). Despite negative reviews - it works just fine with 6th generation processors (I have it running with an i5-6500). I can't vouch for 7th generation processors, but other reviewers are probably correct when saying that you'll need a 6th generation to get the BIOS update to support gen 7. No problems with wireless or any other I/O. No issues with drivers or anything when using Windows 10. Overall a decent budget mobo. Please do note, again, that this review is for the mobo when a 6th generation Skylake is used.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel K

customer_reviews.title: Great Audio
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little motherboard. It's honestly smaller than I needed it to be, but that just makes for an excessive amount of space in my computer case. My only problem was I thought it had 4 ram slots, but that was just my fault for not double checking. The audio capabilities of this motherboard are why I gave it 5 stars. The sound quality is better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kirkham

customer_reviews.title: Tech Support is the Worst
customer_reviews.text: It is so small that everything is a pain to put together, especially if you have a heat sync. It's a good board for first time builders who don't have a lot of add-ons except for the basics. However, the main reason why I am giving it 3 stars is mostly due to the tech support. They are the worse. It is so hard to get a hold of anybody at MSI and they have horrible hours. Good luck catching them if you work!
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Energy efficient motherboard perfect for SFF build
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little mini itx motherboard that comes with everything you need in a such a small package. My favorite feature and the reason I purchased it was the energy conservation mode built in to the motherboard. This is the most energy efficient motherboard available and although this may be of no concern to most people, I wanted to build the most energy efficient SFF PC I could.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Very solid gaming motherboard. Comes with great software, very easy bios tweaking. Only complaint is during GPu installation, you have to manually go to your bios to switch to the integrated graphics to be able to see your screen whil Installing drivers. Otherwise no issues and a nice board for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A.

customer_reviews.title: smelling and working like advertised. It's been my experience that the most ...
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard came in looking, smelling and working like advertised. It's been my experience that the most common piece of hardware to come in DOA is the motherboard and thankfully I did not run into any such issue. Being this is a MINI ITX motherboard it's pretty much as simple as installing the process, RAM, heatsink, plopping it onto the motherboard tray and securing the 4 screws into the 4 standoffs on the tray. I will say that the motherboard is missing some more modern features like USB-C, but aside from that, I can't really find anything to have issue with. If you don't plan on overclocking your processor, pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: m3t4lm4n222

customer_reviews.title: All the bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this motherboard have been using it now for the past three years and I have not come across any issues whatsoever I updated the bios and use the new seven generation processor and it works great
customer_reviews.author: mitsuteck

customer_reviews.title: Does come with M.2 slot
customer_reviews.text: I have read many reviews about this board lacking an M.2 socket, however it's not true, MSI put the socket on the underside of the motherboard just near the CPU socket and the pictures don't show this. I have used this board for a new build, I put a tad too much thermal paste on at first and the CPU light wouldn't go off until I removed some of the excess. I'll edit this review in a couple weeks when I finally transfer my harddrive over and boot it in windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: AMSMPH

customer_reviews.title: KNOW UR CHIPSETS.
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this mobo sucked. Worst time of my life. But it wasn't the mobo fault. I bought a g4560 with the new b250 chipset. Well this mobo doesn't support that out of the box and ud need a 6th gen intel CPU for that to update the bios. But it's a solid board, looks great has nice red leds in the back and is easy to work with. But if you buy this, PLEASE DO YOUR RESEARCH. It'll save you a lot of stress.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that I don't like about this motherboard is that the RAM slots are so close to the CPU. Luckily, I got low-profile RAM (Corsair Vengeance DDR4, 288 pin). If I hadn't, the fan (Cooler Master Hyper T2) would have impeded the RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Ymous

customer_reviews.title: It definitely works.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was afraid because I thought I was going to have to update the BIOS with a chip I didn't have, but luckily the BIOS was already updated, and 2 years later it's still kicking, so that's pretty good. It's small and pretty nice and easy to work with so no complaints from me.
customer_reviews.author: Jakey

customer_reviews.title: Great Mini ITX Build! with some cautions...
customer_reviews.text: this board will NOT run NVMe SSD sticks that are not true m.2 That means SATA versions of the stick drives will not run. Otherwise, amazing board. Had mine over two years.
customer_reviews.author: BiteMyTaco

customer_reviews.title: which works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a budget gaming build to fit in a mini-itx case. The main benefit for me was the built-in wireless AC, which works like a charm. I have continued to augment the system with more SSD and NVMe drives with success. I highly recommend as I really haven't had a negative experience.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Missing part-- I/o shield - great product
customer_reviews.text: They forgot my I/o shield. I know this was a warehouse deal but that's a real bummer. If an administrator is reading this it would be nice if you could work that out for me. But despite that the product still deserves the 5 star rating. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Runningoutofspace

customer_reviews.title: MSI, you stink
customer_reviews.text: Others have commented on the need to update bios. I’ll add that this board with not run intel the i3 6320 Skylake 1151 , not will it run a Pentium g4560 Kaby Lake Lga 1151. You’re up the creek if you don’t have a processor that already works in it to do the upgrade. MSI, you stink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best Micro ATX board that doesn't overclock.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best Micro ATX board that doesn't overclock. Supports 2 case fans if you're interested in that which I always am. MSI know what they are doing. Great audio setting built in. Supercharging for smartphones and 4 red backlighting leds on all 4 corners
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good motherboard for the price and so far has done ...
customer_reviews.text: Good motherboard for the price and so far has done very decent even for being a micro. Had some bent CPU pins though that I had to spend a lot of time fixing and a lot of time figuring out what was wrong in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Good basic motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: I run pfsense on this board with a budget Skylake Pentium chip and 8 gigs of ram. Works reliably so far and no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, DEAD in 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Died within 3 weeks of use. I don't overclock or do any goofy nerd stuff. One day my screen went blank, opened up the computer to see the red LED lighting up and the computer unable to make it even to BIOS. Reset the CMOS, unplugged every component from the mobo and still no dice. Garbage; never being from MSI again.
customer_reviews.author: E Adel

customer_reviews.title: Good budget 1151 Board
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent choice for budget builds. I repurposed some old hardware in a prebuilt for this board (i5-6400, RAM, and Storage). It is easy to install, has good build quality, and has lots of SATA ports. If you're looking for a cheap, but decent board this is a good choice. The BIOS has lots of customization as well.
customer_reviews.author: S. A.

customer_reviews.title: BIOS update is easy and straight forward
customer_reviews.text: Samsung Pro M.2 as boot. Have 2 crucial 2TB ssds connected also. BIOS update is easy and straight forward. GBIC LAN is fantastic. Found a cheap 980 in the midst of the mining craze thanks to a local craigslist seller. Fantastic HTPC board. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ocelot

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap this thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap this thing is amazing. You might think that it would be slower because its smaller, no it is not. this is an insanely amazing mobo that a classic gamer should use. MSI surprised me with this thing. i one day hope to upgrade to a z170 in a year or 2. this mobo can even support the pcie ssd. my specs: EVGA superclocked gtx 1070 i5 6400 16gb kingston ram 1 TB hardrive
customer_reviews.author: shipwrecks

customer_reviews.title: Thought MSI fix thier issue but seems like it carried over the past 10+ years
customer_reviews.text: Died after not even a week. Waiting for Amazon tech support and Mai support to get this replace. If I can have a -5 rating, I will rate it -5. Thought MSI fix thier issue but seems like it carried over the past 10+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stellar budget board, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a decent budget build for a small form factor daily rig, has a lot of features for the money, seriously support for M.2 on a board this inexpensive? REALLY? that just blew me away. good build, form factor I wanted, more than enough connectors for the avg build, awesome price. would have loved a PCIe slot but I can live with out one. Would recommend this for any one needing a cost effective board with great features and solid build quality to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard for what I need
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard for what I need. Looks snazzy, love the io options, and the manual is pretty easy to parse for the info you need. I took a star off because the first board I got had a capacitor issue and would restart the computer randomly. New board seems to be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Faber

customer_reviews.title: with the best driver support
customer_reviews.text: The simplest, most hassle free motherboard, with the best driver support, I've yet encountered. Also has the best wireless card I've ever used - I have not noticed any packet loss when I have a decent signal strength. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great budget mobo
customer_reviews.text: This is a great motherboard for those on a budget, was easy to set up but had a few issues that were related to one of the ram slots. Mobo would not post with both ram sticks in and later found out one slot was bad. Ran well for the day I had it but ended up returning it due to that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little motherboard, this is just what I wanted! I got this board cause its inexpensive and I dont plan to overclock or SLI cards. This board is very nice and works well with my i5-6500 and 16 gb ddr4 2133 ram. Also has plenty of cool features! Great for a budget build that isn't going to use much overclocking(i think this thing can overclock O.o ? ).
customer_reviews.author: JOel corser

customer_reviews.title: Great small ITX motherboard for a small gaming PC build
customer_reviews.text: Great small ITX motherboard for a small gaming PC build, the Intel slot and DDR4 RAM slots allow for high speed hardware and keep size small. I use it for my personal PC and it runs fast and smoothly. The BIOS is easy to use and displays useful information and allow for easy overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lanphear

customer_reviews.title: Great budget motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: I have used MSI motherboards in my last four builds and never encountered any issues whatsoever. This is a great budget motherboard and probably has everything most gamers need.
customer_reviews.author: BillyBob

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Great budget motherboard, easy to setup. My only issue is that if your card is too wide then you will not be able to use one of the PCI-E x1 slot as they are really close to the PCI-E x16 slot. That's something you should keep in mind when buying a mATX board like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Víctor R.

customer_reviews.title: Good budget motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Amazing motherboard for the price It's pretty good all around You get many usb ports, and 3.1 ones too Great BIOS... Only downside is no AC/Bluetooth but that's completely understandable because it's a budget mobo and you can basically fit a card in one of the PCIe slots later on..
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad S.

customer_reviews.title: if cheap was a good thing this board would be the poster child.
customer_reviews.text: needed a cheap board for a cheap customer to run a G4400 and this board fit the profile. very happy and so is my customer. overall system cost was about $250. great board for cheapskates.
customer_reviews.author: electronics for fun

customer_reviews.title: The board works great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to build a new computer to replace my 8 year old desktop. Paired with a i3-7100, 8GB DDR4, and M.2 SSD. The board works great for my needs. I'm not into overclocking so I didn't need any OC features. I did have to borrow a 6th gen cpu to perform a BIOS update prior to installed the i3-7100. Everything works as expected and has been very stable.
customer_reviews.author: brc1981

customer_reviews.title: Easy bang for buck, good enough for modest gaming
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, handles a gtx 1060 3gb perfectly. Very solid budget friendly motherboard for a swap out from a prebuilt 6th gen Intel desktop to a solid gaming rig. Make sure to update that BIOS and you'll be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: FRONITAT

customer_reviews.title: A little cheap but worked just fine. Beware on the type of MITX case you ...
customer_reviews.text: A little cheap but worked just fine. Beware on the type of MITX case you use. The SATA connectors are horizontal so certain cases like the Raijin will not work. The PSU will block the ports.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great budget board
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard has been great. It is missing a handful of things I'd like to see, but at the same time it's $100+ cheaper than the boards that do have those features. I would recommend this to any budget conscious build or to anyone who doesn't need the fancy features and extra ports.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mobo
customer_reviews.text: It has been many years since I built my own PC... this however was for a budget gaming rig for my son. Out of the box, it was nice and easy to get going. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: dunng

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item 3 stars because it was DOA. I was upset that it was DOA but the probability is always there that your item will arrive this way, so I can't remain upset about that. I have no idea how it performs, but installation was easy due to the layout. Anyway, just thought I should add that to the stats pool.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Board was damaged before i got it. Dead on arrival. But gave me a full refumd
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Good MB
customer_reviews.text: Working great, no problems. With a core I3 and Crucial memory, the system power usage is around 36 watts at idle. Not bad, the lowest I have measured for a desktop, although under full power still uses a good amount of power, mainly due to the Nvidia 660 video card I installed.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM M

customer_reviews.title: Good buy if you're a gamer
customer_reviews.text: Really good motherboard. I've not had any issues with it the last 2 years. Just remember that you can't connect an Ethernet cord you'll have to buy a Wi-Fi adapter for your tower.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: Gaming PC Motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works. I had an issue with the sound working on the front jacks of my chassis at first. Had to go to the settings of the Realtek HD Audio Manager and check the box for "Disable front panel jack detection" for it to work. Fault of the manufacturer, it was a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Aundre S.

customer_reviews.title: worth the buy if not going to overclock
customer_reviews.text: good motherboard for upgrading to non-k cpus, even allowed me to upgrade from skylake to kaby lake when i had the money. the misfits get kinda hot though
customer_reviews.author: rocco langieri

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and perfectly functional.
customer_reviews.text: My sons gaming PC crapped out. I wasn’t 100% sure it was the motherboard so I dropped minimal $$$ on this. It fixed it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonfu

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: My hp MOBO stop working. I was told getting a replacement of the old hp MOBO was $270, so I decided to give this affordable MOBO a try. Got it in 2 days and started assembling, so far works pretty well with the RAMs and Nvidia GPU from the previous pc at 1st try. It works, yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: the only reason it got a 4 star is because it wasn't clear that the board only works up to the 6th Generation Intel chip. So if you think that that it will work with your 7th generation and above because it is a LGA 1151 socket, it will not work.
customer_reviews.author: uts library

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. 3months running strong. - i5 6500 - GTX 1060 6gb - Corsair 16gb DDR4 Ram Only flaw, A Cool Master T12 Evo cpu cooler does not work too well. The fan kinda sits on the ram. It did not work at all with the gpu installed. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Tison

customer_reviews.title: Great into motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Great into motherboard. Could come with more fan headers and another USB 2 header, but for an intro H110 mobo I'm not complaining too hard. Simple BIOS and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: PsychTech PC

customer_reviews.title: Very premium feeling board for the price. Red LEDS ...
customer_reviews.text: Very premium feeling board for the price. Red LEDS on each corner is a lovely unexpected touch. Perfectly fast paired with a cheap Skylake Pentium CPU and SSD for a budget build.
customer_reviews.author: Obiwan

customer_reviews.title: The best board out there with LGA 1151 at this price range.
customer_reviews.text: The best board out there with LGA 1151 at this price range.
customer_reviews.author: WEB

customer_reviews.title: SUPPORTS 6th AND 7TH GEN CPUS!!!! NO BIOS UPDATE NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: This mobo was good quality even after being banged around a bit. Completely works for first build and I like the lights. Also another thing that people were saying in the reviews is that the BIOS isn’t updated. Well it is for mine. I was able to put my Kaby lake cpu in and it worked WITHOUT needing an update. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Kim

customer_reviews.title: When I ordered this motherboard I received a defective product ...
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this motherboard I received a defective product. Since the motherboard is extremely sensitive it was most likely damaged on the way here. Luckily Amazon was able to replace this item within the first month of receiving it and this time it worked perfectly. I now made a custom PC and that's what I'm using to write this review. :)
customer_reviews.author: jjrfranco01

customer_reviews.title: ... INTEL 7TH GEN CPU'S OUT OF THE BOX A great little mobo
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT SUPPORT INTEL 7TH GEN CPU'S OUT OF THE BOX A great little mobo. Built in wifi works great, everything else is great as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Randal R.

customer_reviews.title: Wished it had more fan ports
customer_reviews.text: Wished it had more fan ports, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Ish

customer_reviews.title: Great little mobo!
customer_reviews.text: Aside from some connections being in awkward places, this is a great little mobo that you can even stick a m.2 ssd onto the back of! While I wish it could handle faster ram, this mobo is more for those looking for a cheap, but still great, mobo on a budget build.
customer_reviews.author: Ori

customer_reviews.title: Seems to run great
customer_reviews.text: It's working great in my desktop PC so far! The slots are labeled clearly and were easy to read when I was plugging things in.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio in TX

customer_reviews.title: and I couldn't be happier. This board for it's price is a steal
customer_reviews.text: My G-45 Gaming Msi board finally died on me, so I replaced it with this one, and I couldn't be happier. This board for it's price is a steal, I love everything about it. The first one died on me, and they Rma'd it very very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great budget motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: If you're a budget gamer and want a decent gaming motherboard, this one is it. Although it's okay looking, if you're only looking to install a single GPU and have less then 64 gigs of ram, this is the perfect board.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: won't detect GPU
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard for some reason hates GPU's I don't know if it's busted or anything, but the thing won't detect a GPU. Either way this has been frustrating and I'm pretty upset that I'll probably have to send the board back and wait a week to get a new one
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: I've had no problems with this board.
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problems with this board. i5-6500 ballistic sport LT 8gb ddr4 EVGA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti 4GB
customer_reviews.author: operator 4009

customer_reviews.title: Been using the H110 LGA 1151 for 4 months with ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using the H110 LGA 1151 for 4 months with the Pentium G4400! No problems at all! Using it with Linux Zorin Operating system! All worked no problem what so ever!
customer_reviews.author: James w. Silvis III

customer_reviews.title: Not a one day build. You're better off with something else.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with a Core I5 7th gen. Apparently you have to upgrade the BIOS before my chip will work according to MSI tech support. So far not very impressed with with MSI. I'm waiting on a replacement board that supposedly has the upgraded BIOS.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Shields

customer_reviews.title: Good for its price
customer_reviews.text: There are not many ITX boards on the market and this one is one of the best for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: awesome motherboards
customer_reviews.text: as a said in another review i love this motherboards, they always do what they are suppose to do, in this case i order this MICROATX size and at the end i didn't have enough fan plugs, that was my fault anyway
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Increbible
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful motherboard with excellent functionality. I was helping a friend fix his gaming PC and after many comparisons we found this motherboard to be the best option both in functionality and affordability. Works like a charm and his PC has never been better.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Carretero

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to build a media PC for my living ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to build a media PC for my living room, its a budget board so don't expect a ton of bells and whistles but it still a decent board if you know what you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meets/Meets
customer_reviews.text: For $54 I can't beat it. It gets the job done pretty well. The only issue is that on boot, the MSI splash will render over the windows loading screen if pixels haven't changed (aka: the load circle is the only things that appears). 4 stars because while it's a great product, it isn't above expectations.
